page.title: 03Planning the proposed M40
page.content: Planning for the M40 started in 1969 and by 1985 the final route had been settled upon. Construction will commence in 1987 and it will be opened in 1991. The traffic that will use it is expected to be travelling from Birmingham to London and from the N.W. to Southampton and vice versa. This motor way will effect the current traffic flows on the M1,M6, and A41. The motorway will be 57 miles long and will cost Â£220 000 000. It will take up 520 hectares of land but only 3 properties will be destroyed. There will be a service station every 30 Miles, so one will be between Gaydon and Birmingham. Instead of building service stations on the motorway, it is planned to construct them where the motorway crosses a trunk road.
